meanings.definition: Perfunctoriness: the quality or state of being performed in a routine or mechanical way without interest or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The perfunctoriness of his daily chores showed in his lack of excitement.
meanings.sent2: Her perfunctoriness in completing the paperwork was evident from the lack of attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The perfunctoriness with which the cat chased its tail amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The perfunctoriness of the assembly line workers mirrored the monotony of their tasks.
meanings.sent5: The perfunctoriness of the robot's movements made it seem almost lifeless.

meanings.definition: Perfunctoriness: an instance of carrying out a task in a careless or superficial manner.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's perfunctoriness in grading papers led to many errors going unnoticed.
meanings.sent2: His perfunctoriness in fixing the leak resulted in a bigger problem later on.
meanings.sent3: The perfunctoriness with which the chef prepared the dish left it tasting bland.
meanings.sent4: The perfunctoriness of the painter's strokes left the artwork lacking depth.
meanings.sent5: The perfunctoriness of the detective's investigation caused crucial evidence to be overlooked.
